--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "niklassaers" <niklassaers@...> wrote:
>
> Hi=
 guys,
> for our project me and a friend are using JUnit heavily. Our
> app=
lication is a client that collects data and a backend that
> organizes and =
analyses it. Lately we have started to use JUnit tests
> to ensure that our=
 database is sane, and these tests take quite a
> while. Now, I don't actua=
lly need to know that the database is still
> sane every time I recompile, =
so I'd like to ignore them. But adding
> and removing @Ignore's will fill u=
p our CVS repo quickly. Besides,
> I've also set up a box to run tests from=
 cron, and I'd like to i.e. do


There is a @Prerequisite annotation at htt=
p://www.junitext.org/ that
might help do what you want:

e.g., 
	@Prerequis=
ite(requires =3D "databaseIsAvailable")
	@Test 
        public void testDB(=
) {
		// ...
	}
